The Twenty Fifteen theme introduced several changes to the header structure compared to Twenty Fourteen. Here's a detailed explanation of the differences and the reasons behind these changes: 1. Side navigation and sidebar: The most significant change in Twenty Fifteen is the introduction of side navigation and the sidebar. The header, main navigation, and widget area have been moved to a vertical layout on the left side of the page. This new layout is designed to provide better readability and focus on the content, as well as a more distinct and visually appealing design. ```html

``` 1. Secondary toggle button: Twenty Fifteen introduces a new button with the class `.secondary-toggle`. This button is used to toggle the visibility of the widget area and navigation menu on smaller screens, providing a responsive and mobile-friendly design. ```html
